result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge Flores Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jorge Flores Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jorge Flores Jr was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ORDER CONCERNING SENTENCE ADJUSTMENT; signed, filed, and distributed. Clerk mailed copy to Defendant. 
THE COURT ORDERS: The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc

Count one.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (29 pages) commencing 10-01-2015 received and filed.  CH
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Jorge Flores in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Jorge Flores in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, with credit for 262 days time served CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be collected during period of extended supervision, of, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision:
- participate in AODA treatment and aftercare programming
- completion of GED/HSED 
- maintain employment
- cognitive behavioral programming 
- evaluation by clinical services 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended and he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing submissions of defense.
filed with restitution worksheet.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Jorge Flores not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to conduct sentencing hearing today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge Flores in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Jorge Flores in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in to case.
AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  PSI was ordered with recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Jorge Flores not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Motion will be heard on trial date.

to Suppress Identification.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Jorge Flores not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.    Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3.31.15 and for jury trial on 4.13.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge Flores in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Jorge Flores in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Lackovic-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Maria B; Victorio V; Jesus B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jorge Flores in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jorge Flores in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
